tournament.name: Week of Wings Entry Event Thursday Flight 1

decks.notes: The primary focus of this deck is to quickly push damage through aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck features efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, along with powerful equipment like Embercleave to maximize damage output. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, utilizing cards like Fervent Champion and Anax, Hardened in the Forge to maintain pressure on the battlefield. By curving out with strong creatures and burn spells, this deck looks to burn down the opponent's life total before they can stabilize.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells and board wipes to keep the opponent's threats in check. It also focuses on generating card advantage through cards like Treacherous Blessing and Trail of Crumbs. The deck utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value by flickering permanents and generating card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of creatures and ramp spells to stabilize the board and eventually win the game through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing mana-efficient creatures like Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig and Questing Beast, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. The Great Henge provides additional resources and buffs for your creatures, while cards like Ram Through and Primal Might help clear the way for your attacks. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and efficiency in order to outpace opponents and secure victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. It aims to stabilize the board with cards like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Negate. The deck also includes a combo with Transmogrify and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to potentially cheat out powerful creatures. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy with enough colors to cast all spells consistently. With Yorion as a companion, the deck can generate additional value from entering the battlefield triggers.

This control deck aims to utilize Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to maximize value from flickering permanents. The deck includes a variety of removal spells and enchantments to control the board, as well as card draw and ramp cards to maintain card advantage and hit land drops consistently. The deck also features a toolbox approach with Enigmatic Incarnation to find specific creatures to deal with different threats. The overall strategy revolves around setting up a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main goal of this deck is to maintain control over the game through disruption, card advantage, and milling the opponent's library. By using counterspells, removal spells, and strong creatures like Soaring Thought-Thief and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, the deck aims to limit the opponent's options while advancing its own game plan. Cards like Cling to Dust and Agadeem's Awakening provide additional utility and resilience. The combination of mill cards like Ruin Crab and card draw spells like Into the Story allows the deck to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's gameplan while slowly building up its own resources and advantage. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is used as a companion to provide additional value by allowing the deck to replay low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck also includes a mix of spells and creatures to help maintain control over the game and close out the match with incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through countering and removing opponent's threats with cards such as Skyclave Apparition and Shatter the Sky. It also aims to generate card advantage and gain life through cards like Mazemind Tome and Dream Trawler. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for more triggers. The deck also includes multiple sources of card filtering and selection to ensure consistency in finding the right answers. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and grind them out over the course of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing control spells and disruptive creatures to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The main goal is to control the game by countering threats, removing opponent's permanents, and constantly disrupting their strategy. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recurring key cards from the graveyard. The deck's synergy between disruptive creatures, counter spells, and removal allows for a methodical approach to slowly grind down the opponent and secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through various removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing cards that mill the opponent's deck. It aims to control the board and hand size, eventually winning the game through card advantage and graveyard recursion with Call of the Death-Dweller. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently removing threats and disrupting their game plan, while setting up a win condition with cards like Lullmage's Domination and Soaring Thought-Thief.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on creating a fast-paced, aggressive game plan by playing efficient creatures and utilizing powerful combat tricks like Embercleave and Primal Might to pressure the opponent quickly. The deck aims to curve out with creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Brushfire Elemental, and Questing Beast to maintain board presence while using cards like Bonecrusher Giant to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain, while Shatterskull Smashing helps to clear out blockers or finish off opponents.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle with a mix of creatures and removal spells to control the board and deal damage quickly to the opponent. The key strategy involves utilizing powerful cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, and Bonecrusher Giant to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with spells like Heartless Act and Bloodchief's Thirst. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and removal, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of black and red cards. It aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game using efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Rankle, Master of Pranks, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Murderous Rider and Bloodchief's Thirst. The deck also includes cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Tymaret Calls the Dead to generate value and stay ahead in resource management. Overall, this deck aims to maintain pressure, disrupt the opponent, and close out games quickly.

The main focus of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to consistently apply pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to close out the game quickly. The deck includes key cards like Torbran, Anax, and Embercleave to enhance damage output and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures with powerful combat abilities and impactful spells, the deck aims to establish board dominance and chip away at the opponent's life total, ultimately leading to a victory through relentless aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, quickly reducing their life total to zero. By efficiently utilizing low-cost creatures like Fervent Champion and Akoum Hellhound, along with powerful cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, the goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while dealing direct damage. Castle Embereth provides additional reach, while cards like Rimrock Knight and Anax, Hardened in the Forge offer board presence and resilience. The deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing a mix of cards like Mazemind Tome for card draw, Murderous Rider for removal, and Shark Typhoon for additional threats, the player aims to out-value and outlast their opponent. With cards like Atris, Oracle of Half-Truths and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse providing additional disruption and card advantage, the deck can outlast aggressive strategies and grind out wins through attrition and resource management.
